item.title: Why stocks will sidestep 1920s and 1987 parallels, according to Goldman Sachs
item.description: In a new note, strategists led by Ben Snider warn the market is about to navigate a difficult environment.

item.title: My friend, who had no children or wife, died suddenly. His sister is contesting his will. Will she succeed?
item.description: “He did not intend to leave anything to his sister, his only living relative.”

item.title: ‘Opening up to possibilities’: Olympic diver Greg Louganis on his new life in Panama at 65, after auctioning off his gold medals
item.description: Olympic star Greg Louganis has offered a glimpse inside his life after leaving the U.S.—months after he auctioned his medals to raise the funds he nee...

item.title: An ounce of gold now buys 80 barrels of oil, and other eye-opening stats
item.description: Silver’s market capitalization has overtaken that of America’s most valuable company, Nvidia, as one ounce of gold buys 80 barrels of oil.

item.title: Trump says Venezuela will send U.S. up to 50 million barrels of oil — and he’ll control the proceeds
